title: Market Manager
description:
**Job Basics:**

**Company**: Arlow  
**Territory**: Brooklyn/NY  
**Category**: Market Sales Manager  
**Employment** **Type**: Full-Time  
**Reports to:** CEO  
**Compensation type**: Salary and bonus  
**Benefits**: Medical and paid time off  
**Annual Compensation (based on experience)**: $80k+ with bonus

**WE’RE SETTING OUT TO REVOLUTIONIZE THE WINE INDUSTRY**

Born in Austin, TX. Arlow is a collection of millennial founders and established industry veterans developing innovative beverage brands for the next generation of drinkers. Arlow was founded on the belief that you can moderate your alcohol consumption with low-alcohol wine without compromising on taste.

drinkarlow.com

**Job Description:**

The Market Manager serves as the local representative for Arlow low-alc wines. Works to build the brand and drive sales growth against specific goals starting in the Brooklyn area. The ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience selling on/off premise wine and can tap into their existing relationships with key bartenders, liquor store owners, decision makers and distributor staff. This person has a creative mind and know how to connect our brand with an influential consumer audience. For this position you must be proficient in wine sales within the three-tier alcohol distribution system and be able to work as a team with the different departments of the company to achieve company goals.

As a Market Manager at Arlow the employee is responsible for and not limited to the following activities:

* Achieve volume objectives for the assigned SKUs for your specific market within assigned sales budgets
* Gain extensive portfolio brand knowledge and company cultural knowledge
* Communicate regularly and work effectively with CEO to determine goals, report on performance, and review monthly budgets for market activities
* Number of new accounts per month
* Number of monthly features per month
* Identify target accounts and build relationships with retail managers, distributor sales team, on-premise accounts, bartenders, and local influencers
* Continuously keep a pipeline of new accounts per month and develop monthly features and programs with on-premise accounts with a pre-determined budget per account
* Coordinate with CEO and Arlow creative team to produce menus and table tents as needed for monthly features. Responsible for providing content for creative design.
* Perform and help to coordinate trainings with on/off-premise account staff after product has been placed
* Continuously monitor off-premise accounts for proper levels of inventory and POS and product display
* Coordinate and perform consumer tastings at liquor stores
* Work with brand distributor’s sales personnel on a regular basis to visit accounts
* Identify and maintain strong relationships and working partnerships with key local organizations to carry out engagements that will create brand awareness, encourage trial, generate buzz, and build brand’s fan base
* Provide pictures to be used for social media content and reports to the various brand patrons
* This position will have access to an expense account to be used to manage client relationships. Expenses must not exceed the amount budgeted per month and will require a monthly report to validate expenses at the end of the month.

**Job Requirements:**

* Must have knowledge of brands in the wine and low/no-alc categories.
* Must have a desire to learn and use skills beyond sales, particularly in social media, PR, events management, brand positioning, and other aspects of brand-building
* Must be able to creatively apply sales and marketing resources to achieve goals
* Must possess a network of relationships with decision-makers in bars, restaurants, chains, hotels, and/or liquor stores within your district, and capacity to expand your network.
* Must be energized by an environment in which you work 75%-85% independently as a self-starter (working on your own in the market), and 15%-25% with a core team of co-workers.
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 21+ years old
* Ability and willingness to work nights and weekends
* Willingness to travel (valid Driver’s License)
* 3+ years relevant sales experience (previous experience in Wine & Spirits industry preferred)
* Ability to multitask
* Strong ability to work with different teams
* Proactive and results driven
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
* Self-motivated problem solver
* Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
* Professional, business-like appearance and demeanor

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experience do you have working in sales in the beverage/alcohol industry?
* Why does low-alc wine intrigue you?

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Research Lab Manager
description:
**About Us**

*Transforming Military Medicine to Save Lives Worldwide*

Geneva is a 501(c)3 nonprofit that advances military medicine through research, development, and education as we pursue our purpose to ensure optimal health for service members and the communities they serve.

*Geneva Employees Make An Impact*

As a leader in military medical research, at Geneva, our professionals develop critical solutions – and build rewarding careers. Our team of more than 400 employees across the world joins forces with some of the world’s leading researchers and innovators, who are committed to the advancement of military medicine worldwide.

**About the Position**

The Research Laboratory Manager supports the Principal Investigator with the execution and maintenance of the research study, and the management of study documentation. The Research Laboratory Manager may supervise the work of research study personnel in the performance of experiments, data collection, analysis and reports.

This is an on-site position assigned to the Keller Army Community Hospital at West Point, NY. A thorough government background check will be required.

**About The Project**

The NCAA-U.S. Department of Defense Concussion Assessment, Research and Education Consortium is the largest concussion and repetitive head impact study in history. The project, funded by the NCAA and DOD, launched in 2014 and now includes participants on 30 campuses across the country. The CARE Consortium, part of the broader NCAA-DOD Grand Alliance, is composed of two major components: a clinical study core, which aims to define how symptoms and physical signs manifest and evolve over time in different people (known in the scientific community as the “natural history” of concussion), and the advanced research core, which seeks to identify the neurobiology of concussion and repetitive head impact exposure (how the brain itself is affected).

**Salary Range**

$87,000. Salaries are determined based on several factors including external market data, internal equity, and the candidate’s related knowledge, skills, and abilities for the position.

**Responsibilities**

* Adheres to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA), International Air Transportation Association (IATA), Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and infection control procedures, as applicable
* Demonstrates proficiency in performing basic study related procedures and/or experiments as required
* Assist in the preparation and analysis of laboratory experiments
* Observe recording, measurements, and report results in notebook and technical reports
* Collection of data, data analysis and data entry
* Preparation of interim and final progress reports
* Dissemination of research results
* Process and ship samples according to regulations and protocol requirements
* Receive and record shipments received
* Attend conferences and present research findings on behalf of the research team
* Assist in the preparation of manuscripts
* Maintain and update literature library of journal articles relevant to the research topic
* Maintain the security and confidentiality of all research records
* Ensure cleanliness, disinfection and maintenance of all areas and equipment
* Supervise and train research personnel
* Oversee receipt and inspection of raw materials, lab ordering and stocking, as requested
* Document all correspondence and communication pertinent to the research, as required
* Interact and communicate effectively with Principal Investigator, other site personnel, research participants, The Geneva Foundation and the study sponsor
* Comply with rules and regulations as applicable to assigned duty station
* Maintain and update files of all applicable regulatory documentation for IACUC or IRB (including protocols, approvals, amendments, modifications, etc.) as well as any communications with the sponsor or any other Federal or regulatory office (including prior approvals, change in scope, etc.)

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required
* 3-5 years’ experience in the biomedical field preferred
* 3-5 years non-profit, research, or healthcare experience desired
* 1-3 years’ experience in staff or project management
* Demonstrate competence in oral and written communication
* Must be organized, attentive to detail, and possess a positive, friendly and professional demeanor
* Must be flexible with changing priorities and able to communicate in a diplomatic and professional manner
* Ability to exercise independent judgment in fast-paced, high-pressured environment with strict deadlines and to manage multiple projects
* Computer skills including at least intermediate level experience with Excel and other Microsoft Office Software
* Masters in Science is strongly preferred Strong data management and processing skills

**Benefits**

Our benefits package includes financial rewards that are a significant part of the employee's total rewards compensation package. Geneva's highly competitive benefits include medical, dental, and vision healthcare, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings account, with employer contribution. Coverage is provided for employees and family members including domestic partners. Short-and long-term disability, Employee Assistance Program, Life & ADD insurance, 403b retirement plan with generous employer match, flexible leave options, 11 paid holidays per year, and up to 4 weeks of paid time off in a rolling year. Employees may qualify for PSLF as Geneva is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Full time positions come with all benefits. Part time and intermittent positions may vary.

**The Geneva Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.**

title: Cashier
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has locations in Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Cashier
  
**Position Type:** Part Time
  
**Location:** Paramus, NJ
  
**Pay:** $16 - $16.15 per hour – paid weekly
  
**Shift and Schedule:** Mornings, Afternoons, Evenings, Weekends, Holidays
  
**Age Requirements:** Must be 18 years or older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

Cashiers complete the monetary transaction with customers by scanning and weighing products and accepting money, checks, credit/debit cards, or other form of payment for purchases. Operate cash register in food store or outdoor season shops.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Welcoming customers and answering any questions they have about our products
* Balancing cash register
* Bagging items
* Generating the correct amount of change for customer
* Provide exceptional customer service


**What you bring to the team:**  

* Great work ethic
* Honest worker
* Flexible
* Great Customer Service
* Excellent Communication skills
* Willing to work in other departments as the business needs


**Working Conditions:**  

* Requires frequent walking, standing, reaching and bending, with occasional lifting up to 30 pounds
* Requires repetitive motion of arms and hands
* Potential exposure to hot and cold weather when operating cash register in outdoor seasonal shops


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, on-demand pay, weekly paychecks, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?
  
  

**Pay Day:** We’re thrilled to offer our employees Dayforce Wallet – a new way to get paid. Say bye-bye to payday and hello to pay your way. Get your pay as soon as you earn it, at no cost to you – It’s your money, why should you have to wait? Request your pay as you earn it.
  
  

We take pride in the power of diversity, inclusion, and being socially responsible to the communities in which we live and do business
  
  

Apply today and start as soon as possible!
  
  

For more information on working at Stew Leonard’s click on the link below!
  
http://www.stewleonards.com/work-at-stews/
  
  

Stew Leonard's is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Manager, Streaming Growth Strategy
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

The NBCU Ad Sales Strategy team is responsible for driving growth opportunities for Peacock, NBCU Streaming, and the wider sales organization. Acting as strategic consultants, this dynamic team supports Ad Sales and corporate stakeholders across a wide range of initiatives including long-term strategic planning, market/competitive analyses, go-to-market strategies, business case development, sales optimization, and budget planning.


As the Manager, Advertising Strategy, you will interface with business leaders across multiple functions, both inside and outside Ad Sales. We’re looking for a proactive self-starter to bring innovative thinking and strong analytical skills to help grow our business. As an integral part of a blue-chip team with significant media experience, you will impact revenue growth across Peacock & the rest of the NBCUniversal portfolio by identifying and optimizing monetization opportunities.


Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Formulating the long-term advertising monetization strategy across Peacock & NBCU’s Ad Sales portfolio, while ensuring tactical year-to-year progress toward that vision.
	+ Develop business case analyses, evaluating new monetization strategies and “whitespace” opportunities that drive revenue/demand.
	+ Collaborate with stakeholders across business lines to establish buy-in and operationalize strategies, including colleagues in Sales, Finance, Product, Planning, and Marketing.
	+ Support partnership between Ad Sales and the broader NBCU Media Group by building strategies that inform and influence company-wide decisions.
	+ Support evaluation of new ad innovations on Peacock and set priority KPIs to track in-market performance.
	+ Drive marketplace insights to inform long-term growth opportunities.
* Optimizing NBCU’s streaming product strategy to achieve revenue targets while being responsive to marketplace conditions and the competitive landscape.
	+ Support the annual strategic planning process by analyzing the revenue impact of future-facing business cases and ad product development.
	+ Partner with Finance and Planning teams to update financial models, long-term forecasts, and scenario analyses.
	+ Collaborate with Sales and across Strategy teams to develop product solutions for category and client challenges.
	+ Regularly assess in-market performance and Sales feedback & develop recommendations to maximize monetization.
* Developing C-Suite presentations to recommend or inform on advertising strategy, performance, and new opportunities for growth and investment to Ad Sales leadership and/or corporate executives.
	+ Assist business leaders with analyses and presentation support as needed.
	+ Benchmark and develop Peacock’s positioning vs. streaming competitors and the broader advertising marketplace.
	+ Drive ad hoc requests with thoughtful, diligent analytics in coordination with cross-functional partners.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 4+ years previous relevant work experience; this could include media experience at a tech/network/streaming company, professional services (e.g., consulting, investment banking), or corporate strategy/finance.
* Proven quantitative analytical abilities, including Excel modeling skills.
* Strong PowerPoint skills and proven proficiency summarizing information/analyses into coherent and concise slides.
* Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills; the ability to present results of complex analyses clearly.
* Excellent organizational, time and people management skills and the ability to work in groups and independently.
* Must possess a passion for media and strong intellectual curiosity.
* BA/BS required.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* *Previous experience in advertising sales or at a media company a plus. Consulting background strongly preferred.*
* *Passion for diving into complex concepts, defining value propositions, and collaborating with other business lines on long-term growth strategies.*
* *Ideal candidate is a proactive individual who possesses the ability to take initiative and perform analysis and other tasks with minimal supervision, including the ability to deal with competing priorities effectively, and work efficiently in a high-paced, results-oriented environment.*
* *Ability to develop strong relationships with across all levels of the organization.*

**Additional Requirements:**

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.


This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

**Salary range:** $85,000 - $120,000 (bonus eligible)

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Fleet Detailer - Full Time
description:
SCA IS GROWING COME AND GROW WITH US!
  
Our dedicated industry experts have the experience and know-how to get the job done right. While our sole focus is sweeping, our difference is caring.
  
  

WHO IS SCA?
  
Sweeping Corporation of America (SCA) is the largest, self-performing power-sweeping and jet-vac services company in the United States. SCA keeps streets, highways, construction sites, parking lots and industrial/manufacturing complexes clean, free of debris and compliant with EPA regulations. Our proven programs for maintenance, safety and compliance ensure an unmatched reliability and quality component in our power sweeping services. Our 1900+ safety-focused team members currently serve 13,000 commercial and over 600 municipal customers from 72 service locations in 22 states utilizing a fleet of over 1,700 vehicles. In November 2020, SCA was acquired by Warburg Pincus, a leading global private equity firm. The firm has over 55 years of experience in growth investing and building world-class businesses around the globe. Warburg Pincus applies a thesis-driven approach to investing across a variety of sectors and geographies. To learn more about SCA, please visit our website at www.sweepingcorp.com.
  
  

**Job Location:** 350 Faraday Ave, Jackson, NJ 08527
  
Job Summary
  
SCA maintains of fleet of sweepers, dump trucks, flatbed trucks, pickup trucks, trailers, attenuators, and various other support equipment. The Shop Assistant/Fleet Detailer is a valuable support role for our operations.
  
  

**Job Duties:**  

* Maintain the cleanliness of trucks and support equipment.
* Maintain cleanliness and safety of the shop and yard.
* Power Washing assigned equipment and/or sites, as needed.
* Assist mechanics at their direction (Lift, hold, perform basic functions to assist in diagnostic tests).
* Perform basic mechanic tasks, such as changing tires, changing oil, greasing trucks etc.
* Inspect vehicle for any safety concerns; report any warning lights and/or vehicle/windshield/tire damage.


**Job Requirements:**  

* Valid Drivers License, Required.
* Clean Driving Record, Required.
* Mechanical aptitude and industry experience, Preferred.
* Desire to learn and advance into a mechanic or driver position.
* Regular Attendance, Required.
* Use all required PPE, Required.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work a flexible schedule, including overtime and weekends.
* Ability to stand for a full shift in addition to walking, climbing stairs and bending as required.
* Moderate lifting - no greater than 50 lbs.; moderate reaching, pushing, pulling, gripping, and grasping.
* Work performed in outdoor environments and exposure to variable and sometimes adverse weather conditions.
* Work in high noise environments with exposure to vibration and fumes
* May be exposed to solvents, chemicals, and refuse.
* May be exposed to other risks associated with working around machines, tools, and trucks-CDL related.
* This is not an all-inclusive list of job requirements and/or duties and may not contain all mental and physical capabilities necessary to perform the job at all times due to circumstances. Operational, safety and other needs may require the employee to perform any and all other duties as assigned. Employees are expected, and must be able to perform all such duties and tasks.


**Preference will be given to applicants who (not required):**  

* Have a desire to learn and advance into a mechanic or driver position.


**Benefits for our Fleet Detailer:**  

* Competitive Wages
* Weekly pay with direct deposit
* Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance
* 401(k)
* Paid Holidays and Vacation


SCA is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse workforce. SCA does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of age, race, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, or national origin. We believe our differences bring us strength.
  
  

We are a military friendly employer. We are committed to hiring those who have served our country. We encourage veteran, military spouses and family members to apply. Thank you for your service!
  
  

The protection of your personal data is important to us. We will only use your data in the application process and your data is not sold or used for any other purpose.
  
  

Sweeping Corporation of America is an at-will employer and is proud to be a Drug-Free Workplace.

title: Supervising Housekeeper
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Woodhull Medical and Mental Health Center is attuned to the healthcare issues that matter to the people of North Brooklyn. Woodhull focuses on preventing disease and promoting healthy lifestyles by reaching out to the community at various locations.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


Under the direction of the Director of Environmental Services provide leadership, guidance and direction in accordance with departmental goals and objectives by ensuring the cleanliness, safety, and aesthetic appeal of the facilities and grounds.

* Ensure corporate emails are checked daily; respond promptly and courteously to messages.
* Plan and carry out activities in an orderly and well-structured way. Prioritize tasks, use time in the best possible way, and work within appropriate policy and procedures.
* Works effectively as a team member and help build relationships within it. Actively help and support others to achieve team goals.
* Evaluate effectiveness of housekeeping program; study new cleaning methods, equipment and supplies, and requisitions experimental quantities: make revisions and incorporates new methods and techniques.
* Adhere to the guidelines as outlined by the appropriate regulatory agencies.
* Practice infection control, asepsis techniques and isolation procedures in accordance with departmental policy and procedures.
* Ensure all hazardous waste is properly disposed at the appropriate destinations in accordance with regulatory agencies.
* Assign hazardous waste treatment concerns to the hazardous waste safety manager and department directors.
* When assigned, will assist in the collection and hand loading of waste, as well as the transporting of this waste to the final assigned destination.
* Ensure maintenance of housekeeping standards to effectuate germicidal control.
* Regularly inspect to determine if cleanliness standards are being maintained and evaluate physical condition of the hospital.
* Prepare reports: maintain records. Complete required paperwork and other documentation in a complete, accurate and timely manner.
* Display caring actions, even on stressful situations when communicating with patients, visitors and peers.
* Conduct regular inventory of housekeeping supplies and order same, keeping costs in line with approved budgetary amounts.
* Correct unsafe conditions in work area and report any conditions that are not correctable to supervisor immediately.
* Immediately report hazardous conditions which can endanger the well-being of patients, visitors and hospital staff to the appropriate personnel.
* Read manuals to keep current on Housekeeping unit activities.
* Contribute to the success of the organization by participating in the organizational and customer service/employee relations action plan program.
* Maintain confidentiality of patient and hospital records and use discretion when discussing patient and hospital matters.
* Maintain adequate communication with staff, management and department heads in a clear and professional manner and maintain a good working relationship with all divisions of the hospital.
* Assist in the practical reinforcement of all training programs for subordinate employees.
* Assist in the preparation of work crew schedules to ensure maximum departmental efficiency, as required. Establish standards and work methods considering traffic, visiting hours and special assignments that must be completed in a timely manner.
* Review and approve/deny time and leave requests submitted by staff with first consideration given to patient care and the operating efficiency of the department.
* Prepare annual performance evaluations, review them with staff. Provide constructive direction to correct deficiencies.
* Review absence monitoring records monthly for your staff and follow the corrective action guidelines described in Operating Procedure 20-10 and 20-2 to address unscheduled absences and tardiness
* Conduct appropriate disciplinary action with employees as necessary for infraction of NYC H+H and Employee Handbook policies, rules and regulations in accordance with corporate guidelines.
* Consult with superior regarding situations needing specific attention or follow-up.
* Conform to established time and leave regulations and policies; provide proper notification for absences and tardiness.
* Attend professional meetings, workshops, and conferences to enrich knowledge, and to improve.
* Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Six (6) months of experience as a Senior Housekeeper or as a lead or supervising housekeeper for a large organization, such as a hospital, hotel, office or residential building; and  

2. Successful completion of the NYC Health + Hospitals Supervisory Training within three (3) months of appointment.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button. o


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Direct Support Professional/RBT
description:
***Grounded in elements of positive psychology, YAI’s crisis stabilization homes offer detailed analysis and crucial interventions to support people with I/DD and co-occurring diagnoses.***

**Direct Support Professionals/RBTs** **work directly with people under an Applied Behavior Analysis model in our Behavioral Health facility in West Milford, NJ. DSP/RBTs ensure the harmonious and safe daily conduct of the individuals in the Behavioral Health Home, and their overall care and well-being in accordance with YAI program guidelines.**

**Benefits of working with YAI:**

* **DailyPay** - ***Work today, get paid today!***
* 100% employer-paid premium for employee Medical/Dental individual coverage for full-time positions
* Tuition reimbursement
* Paid Vacation/Holidays and Sick Time
* 403(b) retirement with employer matching contribution
* Life Insurance
* Discounts on travel, entertainment, wireless services, shopping, and more!

**Key Functions & Responsibilities:**

* Ensures implementation of plans of protective oversight, as well as Individual Behavior Support Plans (IBSPs)/ Individualized Program Plans (IPPs) for all people we support.
* Assists individuals in maximizing their strengths, interests, and abilities, upholding their personal rights, providing emotional support and building positive relationships.
* Supports people to meet personal goals that characterize quality of life, engages in respectful communications/conversations through person-first language, encourages socializing and facilitates activities that provide social capital and connections to the community.
* Provides support in a variety of settings and in accordance with each person’s individualized service and behavior support plans, utilizing support skills for people with moderate to complex levels of need.
* Consults with program leadership, clinical and other direct support staff to ensure streamlined and top-quality care for individuals and attends and actively participates in team meetings.
* Completes and maintains Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB) requirements for RBT certification within one year of appointment.
* Demonstrates and models all skills of BSP with a person centered and trauma informed approach.

**Behavior Support Specialists must meet the following minimum requirements:**

* HS diploma or its educational equivalent.
* Fingerprinting and additional relevant/required clearances as required by Federal, State and Local government or other agencies.
* Tuberculosis test mandatory for most positions.
* Must hold a valid Driver’s license with no more than 5 points.
* Must obtain Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification within one year of appointment.
* Basic written and verbal communication skills.
* Basic technology skills – including e-mail, utilizing *Workday* and related systems to complete tasks.
* Interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
* Willingness to take initiative.
* Ability to meet essential physical demands of position including: Frequent walking, sitting, standing, bending, twisting, stooping, kneeling, crouching, pushing, pulling and reaching with hands and arms; use hands to handle, finger or feel objects, tools or controls; assisting with lifting/moving individuals of any weight with or without assistance of equipment and/or other staff; lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds on occasion; having the physical capacity to work with and implement emergency interventions as per the person’s Individual Behavior Support Plan and Individual Emergency Intervention Plan, if/as needed.

**Additional Minimum Requirements by State of New Jersey (Behavioral Health Stabilization Homes):**

* At least 6 months’ work or life experience with individuals with intellectual/developmental disabilities and/or behavioral challenges
* Must hold a valid Driver’s license with no more than 5 points
* New Jersey State drug test screening is mandatory

**Preferred Qualification Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a Human Services field (e.g. social work, psychology, etc.)
* Knowledge of developmental disabilities, clinical syndromes and/or IDD with co-occurring behavioral/mental health needs.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran.

**YAI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: Retail Warehouse Associate
description:
As a Retail Warehouse Associate, you’ll be part of an energetic and efficient team that’s dedicated to delivering tech products from the store’s warehouse to our customers when, where and how they need them. You’ll retrieve and ship products, restock shelves and take inventory to ensure a great shopping experience. When the situation calls for it, you’ll also directly assist customers and collaborate with other employees on the sales floor.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Unload trucks and record store inventory
* Prepare products to be shipped to other stores and costumers’ homes
* Stock shelves and organize merchandise displays to help customers see what’s possible and quickly purchase products
* Follow established safety guidelines while operating store equipment
* Replenish products daily to ensure they’re fully stocked on the sales floor
* Process online orders and assist other employees with store pickup orders

**Basic qualifications*** Working and thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Working a flexible schedule that matches your availability (weekends, nights, holidays, etc.)
* Moving up to 100 pounds with or without accommodation

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.

title: Caster Machine Operator
description:
**it's what's inside that counts**

**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**
------------------------------------------------------------------

  

There’s more to CMC than our products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, manufacturing facilities, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

* Day 1 Benefits Coverage with low cost Medical, Vision, Dental
* Day 1 Paid-time Off and Vacation
* 4.5% Company Match 401(k) plan
* $500 Annual Company-paid Lifestyle Benefit
* Competitive Compensation and Bonuses
* Company-paid Life and Disability Insurance
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Training and Advancement Opportunities
**Why This Job**
----------------


CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel, construction reinforcement and ground stabilization industries and to grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day brainstorming in an office cubicle, operating a crane, running manufacturing equipment or troubleshooting technical obstacles, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

* Assist maintenance personnel when requested/needed
* Participate in the CMC Safety Programs and proactively uphold the CMC Safety Culture
* Effectively communicate with others about possible production issues, concerns, and needs
* Ensure equipment inspection reports are filled out each shift
* Perform minor/routine maintenance or repairs as needed without the assistance of maintenance personnel
* Responsible for continuous improvement such as suggesting improvements in work methods and procedures
* Responsible for daily housekeeping duties including but not limited to immediate work area
* To give relief to any of the overhead crane operators
* Troubleshoot work related problems using job knowledge, experience, and by communicating with others
* Understand start up, shutdown, and emergency procedures
**What You'll Need**
--------------------

* Ability to work as a team player in a fast-paced environment, with excellent strong work ethic, attention to detail, and organizational skills
* Ability to work with exposure to extremes in temperature, chemical, dust fumes and mists, uneven surfaces, loud noise, elevated work areas, and confined spaces
* Basic computer skills
* Dependability in attendance, work completion, and flexibility to meet business needs
* Must be able to learn quickly and multitask
* Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs
* Some overtime will be required
* Work on a rotating shift which may include weekends and holidays
**Your Education**
------------------

* High School Diploma or GED required

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.

  

If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

 *CMC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, or other status protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: Care Coordinator
description:
*Health Home Care Coordination Care Coordinator*   
***WE HAVE FULL-TIME AND PART-TIME POSITIONS IN BROOKLYN AND MANHATTAN. PLEASE INDICATE WHETHER YOU ARE INTERESTED IN A FULL-TIME OR PART-TIME POSITION. ALSO INDICATE THE BOROUGH YOU ARE INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR.***

Scope of Position: Under the direction of the Clinical Supervisor, the Care Coordinator works with members and the member’s network of providers to help minimize barriers to care and help members achieve improved health outcomes. Using interventions such as care coordination, motivational interviewing and health promotion, care managers help members, over the course of time, develop the skills needed to manage their health and psychosocial needs with greater independence. Care Managers will have the opportunity to work as part of outcome driven integrated team aimed at improving the delivery of care to individuals living with chronic illness and behavioral health issues.

**Essential Position Functions**:

1. Work with the population served by the Health Homes Program, which includes adults living with a serious mental illness, adults with chronic medical conditions, and/or individuals with a history of alcoholism and/or substance use disorders; conduct initial assessments and reassessments of members’ needs, including medical, mental health, substance use, financial, housing, and support needs; develop person-centered care plans with documented input and approval from other providers and the member in adherence with Health Home standards.

2. Work with member’s medical and behavioral health staff to develop, implement, and coordinate the care plan for clients with chronic illnesses, such as diabetes, asthma, congestive heart failure, hypertension, behavioral health conditions, and HIV, among other illnesses, based on the Health Home chronic disease care coordination model standards; coordinate member services with all service providers through regular case conferencing in accordance with Health Home guidelines; conduct field visits to individuals in their homes or location of their choice to provide services.

3. Must be comfortable doing field work in different settings like, but not limited to, shelters, SRO’s, substance abuse programs, mental health facilities and hospitals; responding to questions and concerns and contact other care providers and community resources to ensure that individuals are receiving needed care; documentation of contacts and attempted contacts and all other documentation within required time frames

4. Attend staff meetings, supervision, conferences and trainings, as required; adhere to all approved Bridge personnel Health Home policies and procedures. Any other duties as may be assigned.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* B.A./B.S. level professional with at least two years' experience working with the Mentally ill/Substance Abuse population. Minimum of 2 years in a mental health setting
* Experience with electronic record systems strongly desired.
* Willingness to travel by public transportation through the Bronx and Manhattan and the ability to manage time and meet program / regulatory requirements are essential
* Must have experience in outreach, client engagement, assessment, direct service and treatment, and documentation
* Bilingual English/Spanish a plus

**The Bridge is an AA/EOE**

title: Coordinating Manager - Level B
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Gotham Health is one of the largest Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) in the country, providing coordinated world-class primary and specialty care with dignity and respect for all New Yorkers, without exception. At Gotham Health, we practice a person-centered caring culture that values delivering compassionate, quality healthcare in partnership with our patients, community organizations, and staff. Gotham Health is focused on high-quality, affordable care to everyone regardless of ability to pay or immigration status. Gotham Health serves the community through a two-pronged approach: providing treatment to those who need it while at the same time emphasizing prevention. We strive to deliver services in a way that maximizes each patient's opportunity to achieve successful health outcomes, we believe in every person's right to participate in their care plans, we facilitate partnerships with other community resources to meet the needs of our patients beyond healthcare, and we celebrate and recognize the compassionate care of our committed staff. Join our team if you want to be part of our Gotham Health Family, a person-centered, fully integrated, and innovative ambulatory care network that enables all New Yorkers to live their healthiest lives.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**PURPOSE OF POSITION**  

Support Gotham Health facilities to maintain NYS PCMH accreditation for 12 Health Centers and conduct regulatory readiness assessments to all 30+ Health Centers across Gotham Health

 **AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Assist during regulatory readiness mock surveys.
* Support the implementation of the NCQA and NYS PCMH requirements.
* Support the review and update of all program related policies and procedures.

 **SUMMARY OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**  

1. Serve as the PCMH Lead for one of the Gotham Health Region, a liaison between the clinical and administrative leadership for the facility and the Central Office PCMH team by: a. Maintaining open lines of communication. b. Participating in meetings and other relevant discussions on initiatives/activities aligned with NYS Health Regulations. c. Coordinate trainings and or in-service across multiple subjects and areas of expertise, to enforce staff awareness of current NYSDOH and NCQA PCMH standards and requirements


2. Responsible for ensuring that Gotham primary care practices are following NCQA PCMH standards and working towards compliance for the new NYS PCMH standards by: a. Conducting site-level PCMH monthly meetings with the primary care teams, process owners and appropriate leadership. b. Conducting regular audits of data/reports, documentation, and processes ensuring that items meet the standards of government and accreditation agencies c. Conduct readiness assessment to non-accredited facilities to facilitate their initial application process, and ensure a successful accreditation outcome. e. Facilitate sharing of best practices across sites.  

3. Make connections with staff and fellow colleagues by: a. Connecting with frontline staff across all departments involved to support and guide their process b. Establish linkages and collaboration for primary care transformation concepts (e.g. managed care office; behavioral health department; IT/telecommunications departments, etc.). c. Connecting with fellow CO PCMH facility leads, for knowledge sharing and collective troubleshooting.  

4. Prepare for application submission by: a. Facilitating evidence gathering for the NYS PCMH application by completing the PCMH requirements' tracker b. Uploading site-level evidence/documentation to the PCMH SharePoint site.  

5. Active participant and collaborator to the Gotham Policy and Procedure Sub-Committees to enforce all required policies are up to date  

6. Collaborate with Quality Team on the implementation of the site-level quality improvement efforts toward primary care transformation; identifying areas of improvement and recommending actions for each primary care practice and/or care team.  

7. Possess a working knowledge of primary care operations, maintain working relationships with the primary care practice managers/ PCMH Site leads and performs related work as assigned by the executive leadership.  

8. Maintain and monitor the PCMH SharePlus, uploading supporting documentations and resources.  

9. Travel to Gotham facilities in a regular basis; as well as during mock surveys and or readiness assessment evaluation.  

10. Other duties required by regulatory agencies and Gotham Executive team


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling; and  

2. Two (2) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, one (1) year of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician; or two (2) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including one (1) year in a supervisory or administrative capacity; or  

3. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines listed in “1” above; and  

4. Three (3) years of full-time experience, as described in “2” above, including two (2) years of experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations, as listed in “2” above; or  

5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.  

  

Note: Certification or licensure may be required.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------

  


**QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOB: CERTIFICATION(S)/LICENSE(S):**  

Bachelor's Degree, (Master's Degree preferred) from accredited college or university in Health Administration, or approved related program Knowledge and experience in NCQA and NYSDOH PCMH program requirements  

A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience

 **COMPUTER PROGRAMS/SOFTWARE OPERATED**


EPIC and Microsoft Office Applications: excel and PowerPoint is a plus


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button  

  

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

description:
**Job Title:** NG911 Integration Architect
  
  

**Labor Category:** Specialist 3
  
  

**Job Location:** 2 Metro Tech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11201
  
  

**Job Type:** Contract 12 Months
  
  

**Work Schedule:** Normal business hours Monday-Friday 35 hours/week (not including mandatory unpaid meal break after 6 hours of work)
  
  

**Pay rate:** $90 - $100 per hour
  
  

**Job Description / Justification:**  

SCOPE OF SERVICES
  
  

**TASKS:** OTI - Integration Architect
  
  

* Provide consistent and secure integration solutions across the enterprise, as well as recommendations of business requirements; collection, identification, and approval of technical specifications; and the subsequent development of technology solutions.
* Work with Engineers, Applied Engineers, Architects, and Project Managers to ensure delivery of desired functionality, requirements, and interoperability of the system of systems.
* Ensure stable enterprise, system of systems architecture by following best engineering practices.
* Lead comprehensive end to end thread testing discussions and identify areas for automation and scripting wherever possible.
* Provide engineering assistance for creating, optimizing, and executing QA/Acceptance Test Plan (ATP) test plans across enterprise


**MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE Note:** Candidates who do not have the mandatory skills will not be considered
  
  

* Minimum 12 years of experience in a particular technical and/or business application, product, platform, methodology or skill set
* Ability to design a strategy around a defined application or process.
* Clear understanding of the systems development life cycle.
* Strong written and oral communication skills as well as presentation and facilitation skills.
* Organization, creativity, flexibility, and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously under tight deadlines.
* Subject Matter Expert of Enterprise Integration and design of Mission Critical 911 systems of systems.


DESIRABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
  
  

* At least 12 years of experience in Enterprise Integration, Engineering, Testing, and QA, experience within Public Safety environments.
* Bachelor's degree in IT related field.


**SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:** N/A

title: Forklift Operator - (Part- Time) - Afternoon Shift
description:
**What you’ll need to succeed as a Forklift Operator at XPO**


Minimum qualifications:

* Be at least 18 years of age
* Able to do basic math calculations, with and without a calculator
* Available to work a variety of shifts due to varying freight volumes, including days, evenings, nights and weekends

  

Preferred qualifications:

* Dock or warehouse experience in the transportation industry
* Forklift experience in a freight or less-than-truckload (LTL) environment
* Experience loading and unloading trailers
* Strong attention to detail and desire to succeed

 **About the Forklift Operator job**


Pay, benefits and more:

* Expected pay range: $23.85 to $29.34 per hour. Pay is on an annual step progression. Actual compensation may vary due to factors such as experience and skill set
* Afternoon Shift 4:00pm - 9:00pm
* Competitive and comprehensive benefits options available for those scheduled to work 30 hours or more/week
* This is a Motor Carrier Act Exempt position

  

What you’ll do on a typical day:

* Efficiently sort, handle, load and unload palletized and non-palletized freight
* Use appropriate motorized and manual equipment, including pallet jack and forklift
* Secure freight inside trailers using appropriate tools and supplies
* Work in a safe, efficient manner, adhering to company safety policies
* Use mobile handheld devices to scan and track shipments
* Work on a dock that is not climate-controlled for extended periods

  

Forklift Operators are required to:

* Lift freight and other objects of various shapes, sizes and weights (frequently up to 50 lbs. and occasionally greater than 70 lbs.)
* Safely walk and stand for extended periods on a loading dock that is not climate-controlled and may be slippery
* Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel as necessary

 **About XPO**


XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

  

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

  

The above statements are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties and skills for this job classification.

title: Assistant Project Manager - Procore Administrator
description:
Job Title: Assistant Project Manager – Procore Administrator

Location: NYC Office

Reports to: Chief Operating Officer

**Job Description**

We are looking for an experienced Assistant Project Manager (APM) – Procore Administrator with extensive knowledge of Procore to ensure that we maintain accurate and consistent information in Procore. You will assist the project team to organize and oversee construction procedures in Procore and ensure that those procedures are completed in a timely and efficient manner. An excellent APM- Procore Administrator must be able to learn about changes and updates to the Procore software as they occur, evaluate the value of those changes and updates, and present those changes and updates to the Project Management Team. The ideal candidate will have an analytical mind and great organizational skills.

**Responsibilities**

**The APM- Procore Administrator will be responsible for all the following Processes, Procedures, and documents in Procore:** 

* Standard Document Implementation.
* Project specific Document Formatting.
* Management of the Document Control system and process.
* Assist with and confirming the receipt of Daily Reports.
* Document and Report Preparation from Procore for PM’s weekly meetings.
* Hold training sessions on Procore features Bid Solicitation and Tracking
* Project Files Setup & Maintenance (hard & electronic copies).
* Document Distribution.
* Monitoring/Tracking and Notifications regarding Contractor administrative deliverables (Contract, Insurance, Requisitions, Waiver of Liens, Health & Safety Plan, Contact Information, Permits, Schedule of Values, Submittals Schedule, Schedule, OSHA Card Records for subs).
* Create and maintain the workflows.
* Load MS Project Schedules into Procore.
* Load all submittals into Procore and send them to appropriate parties for approval.
* Load all Drawings and Project Documents into Procore and send them to appropriate parties.
* Bid Outreach/Status Logs.
* Contractor Deliverables Log.
* Permit Status Log.
* Contract Document Log.
* Create and maintain the workflows.
* Sketch Log.
* RFI Log.
* Submittal Log.
* Notices and Directives to Contractors.
* Correspondence.
* Project Directory.
* 2 Week lookahead.
* Long Lead Item tracker.
* Anticipated Cost Report and all related data input for project financial management.
* Assist the Project Team in preparing, reviewing, and approving requisitions for payment through Procore.
* Invoicing JCT Contractors, Consultants, Vendors.
* Bidder Solicitation.
* Contractor/Vendor/Consultant Applications for Payment Processing.

**Skills:**

* Experience in construction project management.
* Procore Certification for all modules.
* Basic understanding of construction procedures and material and project management principles.
* Familiarity with quality, health, and safety standards.
* Good working knowledge of MS Office suite of products.
* Familiarity with other construction/ project management software, specifically MS Project.
* Outstanding communication and negotiation skills.
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
* A team player.
* BSc/BA in engineering, building science or relevant field.
* PMP or equivalent certification will be an advantage.

title: Warehouse/Tile Sample Board Associate
description:
Nemo Tile + Stone has been a fixture in the stone and tile market, providing beautiful, high-performance surface materials since 1921. At Nemo Tile + Stone, our mission is to provide high-performance and design-driven products with the knowledge and resources that our clients have depended upon for over 100 years. From residential, retail, hospitality, healthcare, and everything within commercial interiors and architecture, Nemo has something for every space at any budget.

Where every detail matters, our team's extensive knowledge translates into all aspects of the tile selection. As the industry continues to evolve, we remain committed to delivering exceptional service and superior products that provide you with an unparalleled experience.

**The Position:**

**Primary duties.**

·

* Create sample boards by measuring, assembling, gluing, and grouting various tiles and stones.
* Use a Wet Saw to cut Tile.
* Sand, cut and fit boards together for an accurate and polished finish.
* Wrap and package sample orders/boards for shipment
* Manage Sample board inventory
* Assist Sales team with Sample boards
* Assist with other warehouse tasks, such as picking and packing orders, conducting inventory counts, and preparing merchandise for shipment.
* Responding to all requests with availability of samples or tracking numbers.
* Labelling all samples correctly, organizing shelves and sample replenishment for the showroom library.
* Noting what items are running low, reordering materials for sample stock.
* Maintaining a clean and organized workplace.

title: Setter
description:
We have many opportunities available on our other career site pages. Click here to link to our careers page!


Our banner is part of Signet Jewelers, a purpose-driven company who believes love inspires love and whose mission it is to enable all people to Celebrate Life and Express Love. Signet Jewelers is also a “Great Place to Work-Certified™” company. Innovation and brilliance – two things that set us apart. Join us!

**Setter:**


R2Net is a diamond bridal jewelry company with a technology soul. R2Net Inc. is an innovative technology company that provides e-commerce and supply chain platforms to connect the entire span of the diamond industry’s ecosystem, including manufacturers, retailers, and consumers.


We are seeking a skilled and experienced Diamond Setter to join our Manufacturing Team. As a Diamond Setter, they will be responsible for meticulously setting and securing diamonds and gemstones into various jewelry pieces. The ideal candidate should possess a keen eye for detail, technical expertise, and craftsmanship that will contribute to the creation of exquisite jewelry items.

**Responsibilities:**

* Carefully examine jewelry designs and specifications to determine the appropriate setting technique for each diamond and gemstone.
* Utilize a variety of hand tools, such as tweezers, prong pushers, and pliers, to set diamonds and gemstones onto various jewelry pieces.
* Ensure accurate placement and alignment of stones – ensuring symmetry and aesthetic quality of appearance.
* Employ various techniques – bezel, prong, pave, channel, and flush setting, based on design requirement.
* Safeguard the integrity and quality of stones during the setting process to ensure no damage or scratches occur.
* Collaborate with the quality control team to ensure all finished pieces meet quality standards and guidelines.

**Requirements and Qualifications:**

* GED or equivalent high school diploma.
* Proven experience as a Diamond Setter within the jewelry industry.
* Strong understanding of different metals and their properties as well as interactions with stones during the setting process.
* Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity.
* Keen attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines while maintaining quality.
* Good communication skills and ability to collaborate with teams.


Base pay is $20 per hour. Final pay shall be determined and is based on experience and qualifications.


Don't forget, We have many opportunities available on our other career site pages. Click here to link to our careers page!
company_description: Signet Jewelers is the world’s largest retailer of diamond jewelry, with over 3,300 stores and Design & Service Centers in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada.

title: Retail Salesperson
description:
**Company Overview**
====================


Bridgestone Retail Operations (BSRO) is part of Bridgestone Americas and employs over 22,000 teammates in North America. BSRO operates more than 2,200 company-owned stores, including Firestone Complete Auto Care, Tires Plus and Wheel Works locations. With locations across North America and more than $3 billion in tire and auto service sales, Bridgestone Retail Operations is the right place to build a career.

  

Whatever role you fill, when you represent the Bridgestone name, you are a valued teammate, and part of our larger mission to “Serve Society with Superior Quality.” We start by offering each teammate more than just competitive pay. We provide formal training, performance incentives, paid vacation and holidays, competitive healthcare packages for full-time and part-time employees, and a 401k plan to help build towards your future.

  

We believe people can only provide superior service and quality to others when they are allowed to bring their whole self to work and know they are supported. We believe in championing all perspectives, individuals and teams because we understand the importance of seeing the world and our business through many different lenses. We are building a team as diverse as the world we serve. So, show us what you’re made of. Show us the smart stuff, the tough stuff, the bold, beautiful and brave stuff. Because who you are is what we need.

**Job Category**
================


Retail**Position Summary**
====================


An energetic position to provide customer needs in person and on the phone. Use your communication skills to explain warranty options, establish time commitments between technicians and customers, checkout procedures and promotion of products and services.**Responsibilities**
====================


An energetic position to provide customer needs in person and on the phone. Use your communication skills to explain warranty options, establish time commitments between technicians and customers, checkout procedures and promotion of products and services.

**Minimum Qualifications**
==========================

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 2-years of consumer retail sales experience
* Must be able to communicate with and assist customers in the areas of sales and complaints to ensure customer retention and loyalty
* Problem solving as it relates to customer complaints
* Must have a valid automobile driver’s license at all times and be able to drive customer and company vehicles
* Must complete and maintain all of the current and required Firestone Complete Auto Care store education courses & modules required for this position

**Our Crew Knows Benefits**
===========================


Health benefits that start on day one of employment, for all of our full-time teammates:

* Paid vacation and holidays
* On-the-job training and company-funded ASE certifications
* Tuition reimbursement program
* 401(k) match
* Vision and Dental Coverage
* On demand pay (daily pay) program available

**Our Values Give Back To You**
===============================

* Professional Development: No matter where you’re at in your career, we’ve got the resources to help you level up.
* Community & Involvement: We pride ourselves on working with our local communities and giving back where we can.
* Integrity & Teamwork: Part of what makes our teams different is our family-like mentality and drive to do things right, always.

*Bridgestone is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. It is our policy to consider for employment all individuals regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

**Employment Eligibility**


If hired, a Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification must be completed at the start of employment. Temporary work authorization or the need for sponsorship may disqualify you from employment.

title: Preschool Music Teacher
description:
**Preschool Music Teacher**

Are you interested in a rewarding career working with children?

Do you have a background in music? Are you enthusiastic and want to share your knowledge with those willing to learn?

If so, this may be the path you’ve been searching for. Join us at the Darien YMCA as the Preschool Music where you can utilize your passion for music along with your skills and abilities to plan fun and engaging supervised activities for pre-school age children. Introduce children to interactive activities focusing on different learning styles and cultivating a love for music!

**Part-Time Position Available**

Monday – Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:45 PM

Under the direction of the Youth Services Director, the Music Teacher develops, implements and supervises and engaging weekly music and movement program to meet the needs of the preschool children. As an enthusiastic leader who creates a welcoming environment where children can learn and grow, you also encourage each child to participate in individual and group activities.

**Some of the exciting duties and responsibilities of the Preschool Music Teacher include (but are not limited to):**

* Plan, prepare and teach weekly age appropriate music and movement activities for children ages 2-5.
* Develop interactive lesson plans designed to engage and educate children about music, movement and instruments.
* Introduce small groups of children to the world of music using songs, simple instruments, and a variety of instructional materials, resources and experiences.
* Demonstrate an understanding of basic music concepts and communicate those concepts in a developmentally appropriate and age-appropriate manner.
* Incorporate material which reflects various learning styles into lesson plans.
* Prepare and lead special activities (e.g. Holiday programs, Graduation Program).
* Attend departmental staff meetings and training sessions as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Degree in music, theatre, or early childhood education preferred. Ability to play an instrument is preferred but not required.
* Must have basic musical skills/aptitude including ability to sing in front of a group of people. Must have strong vocal skills.
* Ability to interact effectively with preschool age children and parents.
* Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills. Must have effective time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to work as a team with Director and teaching staff.

The Darien YMCA is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.
