title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Beginning in 1968 **HYTORC** has established itself as the worldwide leader in hydraulic and pneumatic torque wrench manufacturing, and has become the most trusted name in the industry. Over our 55 year history we have focused on engineering new technologies while building a 24/7 service network. Our mission: to make industrial bolting simpler, more precise and more reliable. We are proud to be recognized as the innovation leader in our industry, providing award winning solutions to leading businesses globally. Our customers include SpaceX, GE, Tesla, Boeing and many more world class companies. We proudly design and build our products in the USA


**General Purpose**: The Warehouse Manager is responsible for maintaining an efficient system of operation to support the business needs. The candidate should be comfortable multitasking and working cross-functionally with different business units.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Able to motivate, influence, and train people.
* Proactively communicating, coaching and training the warehouse staff and all associates to increase the overall quality and performance of the distribution center.
* Take ownership of all customer orders regarding order accuracy and service performance.
* Labor, Metrics and KPI management.
* Warehouse housekeeping and organization folded into the daily operation.
* Accurate warehouse record keeping as it pertains to: Payroll, Overtime, Temp hours (when applicable), inventory transactions, maintaining inbound and outbound procedures, shipping systems and employee productivity.
* Warehouse safety and equipment operation.
* Planning, directing, and coordinating the distribution of products in compliance with company goals and objectives.
* Analyzing delivery and inventory issues and providing solutions.
* Enhancing and controlling distribution in order to satisfy customer and quality specifications.
* Maintaining employee safety and morale by creating a safe and efficient working environment.
* Maintaining proper employment levels through selecting, interviewing, and training of personnel.
* High-level leadership and decision-making skills.


**Supervisory Responsibilities:** Manage between 25-30 managers, supervisors and associates.


**Education/Experience Preferred**: Bachelor’s degree and fifteen or more years of warehouse management.


**Computer Skills Necessary:** Microsoft Office, EDGE, Dematic and RF scanning equipment.


**Physical Demands/Requirements:** Must be able to perform all physical demands of employees that he manages.


**W****ork Environment:** Warehouse and office setting. Must have the ability to travel to visit vendors and customers when necessary.

title: Case Manager 040
description:
Catholic Charities, Diocese of Metuchen (CCDOM), with more than 450 employees is a non-profit, social services agency with its mission, driven by Catholic social teaching, of providing quality services with dignity and respect to the poor, vulnerable and all people in need and partnering with families and communities to improve the quality of life. We serve more than 68,000 clients per year throughout Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon, and Warren counties in NJ.  

**Case Manager 040 –** Edison, NJ  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Support individuals/families who are referred from social service agencies in Middlesex County experiencing homelessness and are in need of locating permanent housing.
* Work with social service agencies, landlords and government entities to establish relationships to increase available housing stock to decrease homelessness.
* Provide guidance/assistance to landlord unfamiliar with Public Housing Authorities and social service agency forms and processes.
* Be familiar with HUD’s NSPIRE and ensure that units being referred o client with a voucher or subsidy are in compliance and will meet those program’s property standards.

**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree or licensed in real estate.
* 2 years exp in property management/housing.
* Housing First exp; conflict resolution.
* Self-run, work independently/set boundaries.
* Strong interpersonal skills/organized/detail.
* Collaborate with community organizations.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills including in virtual settings.
* Excellent time management/analytical skills.
* Bi-lingual a plus; flex for some weekends/nights.
* Acceptable driver’s license history.

**Benefits:**  

CCDOM offers a competitive benefits plan that includes:  

* Medical and Prescription
* Dental
* Vision
* Up to 13 Paid Holidays
* Begin with 20 Days of Paid Time Off
* Non-Contributory Pension Plan

title: Center Director & Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
**Center Director & Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)** 

**Ascend Autism Group**

**Westport, CT**

**Full-time** 

**Salary: $95,000-$105,000 annually including bonuses** 

Ascend Autism Group (“Ascend”) is an Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy company focused on providing center-based and in-home services for clients. Ascend Autism Group is elevating the outcomes of children diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Ascend is committed to the success of each child and the entire family.

Ascend is currently seeking a BCBA and Center Director to join our growing team of professionals and lead a center-based program in Westport, CT. In general, the Center Director will be responsible for new client evaluation / consultation, behavior assessments, developing treatment plans, on-going case management and ABA Behavior Tech supervision / mentoring. The Center Director will have ultimate responsibility for running the center-based program. In addition, the Center Director will supervise a treatment team of other BCBAs and Behavior Techs. The Center Director position is a salaried, exempt, full-time position.

**Job Responsibilities:** 

* Conduct functional behavior assessments and develop / update treatment plans as necessary
* Lead, supervise and mentor treatment team, including BCBAs and Behavior Techs / RBTs
* Hold quarterly coaching sessions for treatment team. Prepare and review quarterly performance evaluations of treatment team, including recommendations for advancement or other changes in status
* Provide 1:1 Applied Behavior Analysis therapy with a focus on center-based sessions
* Prepare and facilitate on the job staff training
* Oversee and maintain accurate and organized patient notes, data and reports
* Minimize cancellations of scheduled sessions
* Train family members / guardians on implementing the treatment plan
* Participate in team meetings and training workshops
* Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work
* Follow the policies and procedures of Ascend Autism Group
* Abide by BACB guidelines, rules, and regulations

**What we offer:**

* Competitive pay and health benefits
* 401(k)
* Generous Paid Time Off
* A rewarding experience helping children and families reach their full potential
* Paid training / continuing education that will help advance your career
* Professional development, leadership opportunities and scholarship / education assistance opportunities

**Qualifications:** 

* Must be a Board Certified Behavior Analyst
* Must hold applicable state licensure (Connecticut LBA)
* Experience working in-center and developing ABA programs
* Experience supervising paraprofessionals implementing ABA based treatment programs
* Experience working with children aged 2-10
* Experience conducting family trainings on ABA-based treatment plans
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent administrative skills

Ascend is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to make all personnel decisions without discriminating based on race, color, creed, religion, sex, physical disability, mental disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, national or ethnic origin, and any other protected status.

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
**About our company:**

Here at Ivira, we provide care that’s always there. Need a prescription filled? We’ve got all our patients covered. What about an infusion? No problem. Home Health Services? Yes, we do that too. The truth is, we want our patients to get better, and we’ll go above and beyond to make sure they’re cared for in the process.

Everyone’s health is different, which is why we’ve developed a family of services to help our patients no matter where they’re at in their wellness journey.

Care is at the core of what we do, which is why you’ll always find it at Ivira.

**Job Summary:**

As a Pharmacy Technician at Ivira Health, you will be front and center – interacting with our customers and developing strong patient relationships. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a difference by positively supporting our pharmacy teams and providing excellent patient care. Communicating with other health care providers, reviewing patient records, providing immunizations and filling medication orders while following HIPPA guidelines, ensures we are able to meet our patients’ needs.

**General Duties and Responsibilities**

* In accordance with state and federal regulations, assists the pharmacist, under direct supervision, in the practice of pharmacy.
* Enter prescription information into pharmacy computer system, including but not limited to: patient searches, prescriber searches, drug selection, prescription interpretation, insurance billing, and basic documentation.
* Complete paperwork related to filling prescriptions and input customer and prescription data into the computer.
* Accept customer, prescription, and insurance information required to process new and refill prescriptions, including refill authorization from doctor offices.
* Retrieve medication from inventory.
* Prepare prescription medications for dispensing, including but not limited to: Count or measure tablets, capsules, or liquid medications, place medication into prescription containers, create prescription labels, and appropriately label prescription containers,
* Assist with maintaining the Pharmacy department by keeping it clean and in order.
* Assist in inventory management processes including order review, inventory returns, restocking shelves, and physical inventory preparation.
* Adhere to safety practices to ensure quality care for patients.
* Provide customer service by answering phone calls in a prompt and courteous manner.
* Triage patient requests and concerns, and collaborate with team members to assist patients.
* Reports, immediately, prescription errors to pharmacist on duty and adheres to Company policies and procedures in relation to pharmacy errors and the Quality Improvement Program. Reviews and complies with the Ivira Health Code of Conduct.

**Required Qualifications and Experience**

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.
* Previous experience in a pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting.
* Prefer to have previous experience as a Pharmacy Technician.
* Prefer good math skills to allow for accurate filling of prescriptions including counting, measuring, and weighing medications.
* Familiarity with pharmacy practice settings, legal requirements and limitations, prescription information and calculations, drug identification and generic equivalents, drug manufacturing, packaging and labeling information, and proper drug handling and storage practices.
* Good computer skills.
* Good communication skills, allowing for positive interactions with patients, providers, and pharmacy team.
* Prefer the knowledge of store inventory control.
* Experience with Pill-pack machine is a plus.

**Work Environment**

This job operates primarily in an office environment. This position requires the use of standard office equipment, and frequent standing and walking.

**Disclaimer**

The above job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. It is not designed to capture or illustrate a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $22.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Pharmacy technician experience: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Paint Sales / Stock & Delivery Floater (Norwalk/Fairfield/Westport/Wilton/Trumbull/Stratford)
description:
**Paint Sales/Stock and Delivery Floater (Norwalk/Fairfield/Westport/Wilton/Trumbull/Stratford)**

**Ring's End, Inc.** is seeking a determined **full-time Paint Sales/Stock and Delivery** in the **Fairfield County Area** in order to keep our paint operations running smoothly. This position earns a **competitive pay** and is eligible for **great benefits**, including traditional and Roth 401K, 3% 401K safe harbor company contribution, various medical insurance plans, FSA & DCA, employee discounts on our products and materials, life/accidental death & dismemberment insurance, long & short-term disability, paid holidays, paid time off (PTO), employee assistance program, and a legal counseling program. If this retail opportunity sounds like the right job for you, **keep reading**!


Are you a hard worker who genuinely cares about your customers and will go out of your way to make them happy? Are you interested in teaming up with an established building material retailer to **fortify your skills**? If yes, complete our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application** for this Customer Service / Sales Associate position because we want to meet you!

 **ABOUT RING'S END INC**


We are a Connecticut-based lumber and building materials retailer serving Connecticut, South County, Rhode Island, and Westchester County, New York. We are a third-generation, family-run company with a rich history dating back to 1902. Guided by a tradition of service and a commitment to innovation, we are dedicated to becoming the premier resource in the building material industry for builders and remodelers, painting contractors, architects, and homeowners.


Our growth and success are due to our team of professionals. We employ the best team in the industry, ensuring we maintain a **diverse** and **evolving** work environment that values **cooperation and teamwork**. We look for innovation and continuous improvement in everything we do. We're looking for more to join us!

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A PAINT SALES/STOCK AND DELIVERY**

As a Paint Sales Associate, you help in our paint centers to assist our customers with color choices and finishes. You are kept busy with various tasks, from keeping our paint center showrooms neat and clean, handling telephone calls, greeting and helping clients in the store, handling point-of-sale transactions, and creating purchase orders for products. This position requires the incumbent to sell paint, and paint accessories, keep shelves stocked, and deliver materials to contractors, builders and homeowners. The right candidate will be flexible and adaptable to the changes that quickly affect this job. Exceptional customer service and problem-solving skills are a must as well as a clean driving record. Fluent in English and Spanish is a plus! **You feel accomplished using your knowledge and skills to help our clients!**

 **QUALIFICATIONS**


Duties include, but are not limited to:

* Travel throughout our various locations
* Sell the maximum output of allotted products at authorized prices, and in accordance with established merchandising plans and policies
* Correspond with regular customer contacts and potential customers promoting the sale of all Ring's End products
* Instruct customers on use of products
* Handle instances of consumer dissatisfaction and specific customer complaints fairly, promptly, and effectively, and recommend adjustments to management
* Stock Shelves with appropriate merchandise
* Deliver merchandise to customer homes and job sites


Do you have a positive attitude that contributes to high company morale? Are you goal-oriented and self-motivated? Can you connect with our customers and build strong relationships? Are you an effective communicator? Do you present yourself professionally? If so, you may be perfect for this full-time retail position! **Apply now!**

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Kustomer**


Kustomer is the industry leading conversational CRM platform perfecting every customer experience. Built with intelligent tools such as AI and Automation, no code-configuration and a connected data platform that unifies data from multiple sources through a single timeline, Kustomer empowers businesses to operate with greater efficiency and deliver more personalized service to customers across any channel, making every interaction more meaningful and memorable. Today, Kustomer is the core platform for some of the leading customer service brands like Ring, Glovo, Away Travel, Priceline and Sweetgreen.


Kustomer was founded in 2015 by serial entrepreneurs Brad Birnbaum and Jeremy Suriel and has raised over $200M in funding backed by leading VCs. Meta announced its intention to acquire Kustomer in 2020 and completed the transaction in 2022. Kustomer joined Meta’s Business Messaging Group to transform the way people and businesses communicate through modern messaging channels. In 2023, Kustomer spun out from Meta as a standalone company backed by original partners, Battery, Redpoint and Boldstart Ventures, who have invested $60M in capital, ensuring Kustomer’s growth and success for many years to come.


Our Krew is made up of passionate and collaborative people who really care about what they do and the people they help. We look for people who are passionate about enhancing the customer service experience for everyone involved, as it's the core of what we do. We're growing our business with no plans of slowing down. We actively seek individuals who want to learn and be challenged every day. We have also transitioned to a remote friendly company, with Krew members located throughout the U.S. coming together for Kamp Kustomer each year.

**About the Role**


We are looking for an Engineering Manager with Cloud FinOps experience to lead our Foundation team. This team oversees the development of critical cloud backend systems and enables us to support sustainable growth at scale. In this role, you’ll manage a team of software engineers with skills in cloud infrastructure, backend services, and CI/CD systems. You’ll collaborate with our Finance team and bridge the gap with engineering to make well-informed decisions about infrastructure using detailed insights. As a key player in the broader engineering community, you’ll deliver cultural change across Kustomer with an emphasis on cost engineering and spend predictability. If you’re passionate about cost-performance efficiency and eager to lead a team in this area, we want to hear from you.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Manage a team of software engineers with diverse experience (30%)**


	+ Manage employees performance by holding regular 1-1’s, conducting performance reviews, setting objectives for each team member, and overseeing team’s work.
	+ Provide leadership and coaching to develop your team members.
	+ Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the team and top management, as well as provide input into cross-team projects and initiatives.
	+ Support established organizational objectives by developing goals and strategies.
	+ Report on goals and represent the teams to senior leadership.
	+ Participate in hiring and recruiting initiatives.
* **Analyze, design, and develop software to improve the company's platform and expand its automation capabilities. (30%)**


	+ Lead and realize the long-term strategy for cost engineering
	+ Drive accountability in the organization with a balanced cost allocation strategy
	+ Accurately forecast and report cloud costs to various XFN partners
* **Participate in sprint planning, and partner with Product to ensure the team is delivering quality technical output. (20%)**


	+ Lead the team in translating business requirements and R&D initiatives into technical requirements, including selection of appropriate technologies.
* **Participate in cross-team initiatives to drive engineering best-practices (20%)**


	+ Collaborate with XFN partners like the Data Solution team and the Finance team to educate and inform the organization with insights and recommendations
	+ Hold engineering teams accountable for their applications and services ensuring they are aligned with the long-term strategy.

**Your qualifications:**

* You have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
* You have 7+ years of experience in Engineering
* You have at least 3+ years of experience managing a team of engineers
* You have been a leader of a cost engineering effort and/or drove significant impact for cloud cost optimizations
* You have influenced a persistent culture of cost savings and optimizations
* You have partnered with vendors and managed the relationship to extract value
* Technical experience:


	+ You’re familiar with Node.js, and MongoDB
	+ You’ve developed forecasting and cost allocation models in collaboration with Finance teams/depts
	+ Experience with CI/CD pipelines
	+ Experience with Docker, Terraform, and/or AWS
	+ Experience with Elasticsearch, Solr, or Algolia

**HIPAA Compliance**

*All roles at Kustomer may involve handling sensitive personal data.*

**Benefits**


Kustomer offers an array of benefits including competitive salaries, stock options, 100% healthcare coverage, 401K, WiFi and Mobile reimbursement, and a generous vacation policy.

**Diversity & Inclusion at Kustomer**


Kustomer is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives.


We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

***Disclaimer:*** Kustomer only contacts candidates from company email addresses ending in kustomer.com and does not seek funds from candidates in any circumstances.


Compensation Range: $180K - $200K

title: Program Director - SOS
description:
We're seeking a licensed Master’s-level Director (LMSW or LCSW) to lead our SOS program, dedicated to following the CTI model and ensuring adherence to program policies. This pivotal role oversees referrals, canvassing activities, and Outreach in the vibrant Team II catchment area (14th St and below). The Director may manage a small caseload as necessary, strategize high-risk case meetings, and actively participate in key meetings such as MTA and CBHT. Responsibilities also include creating schedules, ensuring the integrity of progress notes, conducting screenings, and reviewing service plan completions. Join us in making a direct impact by driving forward this crucial community-focused initiative.

**SOS Program Director Essential Position Functions:**

* Lead creation of a multi-disciplinary SOS community support team in collaboration with the State Office of Mental Health and SOS Hub.
* Manage day-to-day team operations, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.
* Coordinate outreach in transit hot spots and hospitals, conducting needs assessments for transition planning.
* Develop lasting partnerships with MTA, hospitals, NYPD, shelters, and housing providers.
* Facilitate case reviews and document recommendations for at-risk members.
* Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance, reporting findings to the SOS Hub QPM Department.
* Assist in identifying and implementing quality improvement projects.
* Ensure adherence to regulatory standards in recruitment and performance management.
* Provide individual and group supervision, training, and mentorship to team members.
* Coordinate staff schedules for 24/7 crisis response readiness.
* Collaborate with Single Point of Access to enroll participants and manage staff assignments.
* Engage stakeholders respectfully, considering cultural differences.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* **Must-have**: Licensed Master’s degree in social work, mental health counseling, nursing, or psychology.
* Experience working with homeless and/or precariously housed populations preferred; management skills development interest.
* Knowledge of NYC homeless resources, shelter systems, and MTA transit is advantageous.
* Familiarity with counseling principles for mental illness and substance use disorders.
* Understanding of treatment, rehabilitation, and community support programs for recipients, families, and staff.
* Proficiency in crisis management, de-escalation techniques, and violence prevention strategies.
* Ability to develop, implement, and adjust treatment interventions for individual needs.
* Strong computer skills including Health Information Technology and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Spanish proficiency a plus.

title: Warehouse Shipping Supervisor
description:
Ferguson Associates is a 3rd party logistics pick/pack warehousing facility servicing the beauty, home, and wellness industries. We are a family-run business with exclusive clients. We value employees who want to learn and grow with our company and create long-lasting relationships with us and our clients.

We are looking for an experienced warehouse **Shipping Supervisor** to join our team.

The **Warehouse Shipping Supervisor** is responsible for carrying out the logistics of processing and sending inventory according to purchase orders and shipping schedules. The duties include loading orders onto trucks and shipping containers, organizing outgoing stock, and putting the appropriate labels on outgoing parcels.

**Position Requirements/Qualifications:**

1) High School Diploma or GED

2) Related work experience required

3) Previous WMS experience preferred

4) Reach Truck experience or certification highly preferred

5) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are highly required

6) Excellent organizational and coordinating abilities

7) Ability to work as part of a team and leader

8) Critical attention to the smallest of details when dealing with customers' orders

9) Problem-solving abilities on all fronts

10) Must be someone who is able to multitask and carry out his/her duties based on priorities

11) Able to use email system to communicate both internally and externally

12) Microsoft Office Suite – intermediate-level Excel

13) Warehouse Management System knowledge

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

1) Serve an integral role in the Ferguson Associates business by interacting with all team members

appropriately in the best interest of the company.

2) Adhere to customer shipping guidelines, especially for EDI-compliant customers

3) Make sure all shipping documents and palletization are compliant with individual EDI customer requirements.

4) Use WMS to track, check, prioritize, and route orders

5) Ensure critical documents i.e. advanced shipping notice, pack slips, BLOs are affixed to pallets

6) Complete all shipping documents for shipment, including hazmat documentation

7) Run checks on packaged shipments to make sure proper labels, bar codes, etc. are placed

8) Executed Bill of Ladings (BLOs) and Pallet photos

9) Collaborate with internal departments to optimize the flow of orders from preparation to shipment

10) Communicate directly with internal & external teams as necessary to answer questions, relay shipping updates, and handle complaints calmly and efficiently

11) report back to the office team if the driver is a no-show for scheduled pick-ups

12) Identify shipping issues and implement solutions in a timely manner

13) Make sure FedEx Express, FedEx Ground, UPS, and USPS pick-up is completed by EOD

14) Closely supervise/monitor the productivity levels of the shipping staff to make sure goals/targets are reached

15) Resolve all shipping-related issues that may arise in the company

16) Document processes and submit reports to management as required

17) Reach Truck operation as needed

18) Ensure supplies are ordered timely to cover business needs

19) Ensure workstations are stocked and organized daily

20) Ensure both the shipping floor area and shipping office are cleaned and organized daily

21) Performs other related duties as assigned by management

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

title: Dietitian
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who seek it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking the following healthcare professional to join our team, supporting our Monticello, Spring Valley, Haverstraw and Peekskill health centers. We currently have the need for a Nutritionist at our Spring Valley location.


The Dietitian will perform individual counseling of patients referred by the medical personnel in all sites of Hudson River Healthcare. Performs job duties in compliance with systems and job specific standards.


**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provides nutrition counseling to patients referred by clinicians
* Performs initial nutrition history on each patient
* Develops and implements a care plan based on the assessment of nutritional and health needs
* Provides instructions on a normal or special diet
* Schedules follow-up appointments and evaluates the reaching of goals
* Provides nutrition counseling for diabetic patients as part of diabetic care plan
* Provides nutritional education materials to patients to support counseling efforts
* Makes referrals to other health care providers and community services as appropriate
* Counsels individuals and families on nutrition and diet based on the particular needs of the individual or family as determined by their nutritional and health risk
* Attends staff meetings and in-service training sessions at both local and state levels
* Provides consultation into the development of program policies and procedures
* Provides direction and executes health education programs as needed
* Must demonstrate knowledge and skill necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served
* Must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of grown and development over the life span

Minimum Education Requirement : Bachelor’s Degree


Related Work Experience : 2-4 years


Preferred Education Requirement: Master’s Degree


Preferred Work Experience : 5-8 years


Required Licensure: RD/ RDN and CDN with a valid CPR card


Specialized Skills & Knowledge:


* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing
* Ability to operate a motor vehicle and travel within the HRHC service site area
* Knowledge of nutrition principles as well as knowledge of nutrition during pregnancy and lactation, as well as infant and child feeding practices
* Knowledge of the geographic community serviced and resources
* Competence in nutrition assessment counseling
* Ability to collaborate with other member of Hudson River HealthCare staff in order to maintain high quality standards and achieve client satisfaction

Salary Range: $54,500-$60,000 prorated for part-time


Relation to Mission
  

The mission of Sun River Health is to increase access to comprehensive primary and preventive health care and to improve the health status of our community, especially for the underserved and vulnerable.
  

  

Equal Employment Opportunity
  

Sun River Health provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual preference, or non-disqualifying physical or mental handicap or disability in each aspect of the human resources function.
  

  

Americans with Disabilities Act
  

Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to perform the essential job functions either unaided or with reasonable accommodation. The organization shall determine reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.
  

  

Job Responsibilities
  

The following statements reflect the general duties, responsibilities and competencies considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements of the position. Sun River Health may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice


  
Sun River Health is a network of 43 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need – no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.
company_description: At Sun River Health, we believe that quality, complete health care is for everyone, no matter what you can pay.

If you're ready to shake things up and enjoy a workplace that’s as exciting as it is rewarding, keep reading!

What We Offer:

- Daily Spiffs and Games: Start your day with a challenge and end it with rewards! We believe in keeping things lively with daily spiffs, games, and team-building activities.

- Unmatched Compensation: Your hard work deserves great pay. Enjoy six-figure earning potential and daily cash bonuses for top performance.

- Fun and Unique System: Our approach is anything but ordinary. We thrive on creativity and results, ensuring a dynamic environment where your efforts are celebrated.

- Great Benefits: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. We've got you covered!

Key Responsibilities:

- Welcome and assist customers with their vehicle service needs in a friendly, engaging manner.

- Communicate effectively to understand customer requirements and provide accurate recommendations.

- Prepare detailed repair orders and ensure timely documentation.

- Foster strong customer relationships with exceptional follow-up and communication.

- Collaborate with our service team to ensure seamless and efficient service delivery.

- Drive service department goals and exceed performance targets.

Qualifications:

- Experience as a Service Advisor in a high-volume dealership is a plus (Not Required)

- Passion for customer service and excellent interpersonal skills.

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fun, and dynamic environment.

- Strong organizational skills and multitasking abilities.

- A positive, can-do attitude and a desire to be part of a winning team.

Why Paragon Honda?

- Game On: Our daily games and spiffs make every day exciting!

- Top Pay: High performance deserves high rewards. Enjoy six-figure potential and daily bonuses.

- Supportive Team: Join a team that values creativity, fun, and excellence.

- Career Growth: We invest in your professional development with ongoing training and real career advancement opportunities.

Ready to Join the Fun?

If you're ready to transform your career and be part of an exciting team, Paragon Honda is the place for you. Apply today and bring your "TOP DOG" energy to a dealership that values fun and success.

How to Apply:

Send your resume to apetito@paragonhonda.com or visit us at 57-06 31st Ave, Queens, NY 11377 to apply in person. Let's make your career as rewarding and enjoyable as it can be!

description:

T.F. O'Brien Cooling & Heating

New Hyde Park, NY

Work Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.

Full Time: Onsite

Pay: $21 - $25.00 Per Hour + Commission

***Competitive Weekly Pay + Benefits, Career Growth Opportunities, Positive Workplace Culture,*** ***Stability and Paid Training***

**Are you passionate about making a positive difference in customer's lives? Do you find it rewarding to help customers? Do you have a talent for understanding a customer's unique needs and finding a solution? If so, apply today.**

***(Please apply if you are serious about a career opportunity and have read the Job description)***

T.F.O' Brien Cooling & Heating is looking for an energetic and motivated Customer Support Associate. Will act as a liaison, provide product/services information and resolve any emerging problems that our customers might face with accuracy and efficiency.

The best customer support associates are genuinely excited to help customers. They’re patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative. They love to help people. Customer support associate can put themselves in their customers’ shoes and advocate for them when necessary. Customer feedback is priceless, and the customer support associate can gather that for you. Problem-solving comes naturally and doing the right thing for our customers.

They are confident at troubleshooting and investigate if they don’t have enough information to resolve customer issues. The target is to ensure excellent service standards, respond efficiently to customer inquiries and maintain high customer satisfaction.

* Timely response of follow up of service.
* Promote the service & maintenance plan program to all customers & potential customers

title: Program Director
description:
We're seeking a Director to lead the New York State Office of Mental Health Critical Time Intervention team. This role involves overseeing a multidisciplinary team including an Assistant Director, Master’s level Clinicians, Care Managers, a Registered Nurse, and a Peer Specialist. The Director will initially ensure successful program implementation and subsequently manage day-to-day operations. Essential qualities include a management style that values member choice, harm reduction, non-coercion, flexibility, and a person-centered approach. Building and maintaining collaborative relationships with community partners, especially hospitals and behavioral healthcare providers, is crucial. This position offers a chance to demonstrate leadership in a dynamic environment, contributing to transformative community healthcare initiatives in NYC. Field-based work, periodic on-call coverage, and flexible hours are required, reflecting our commitment to making lasting positive impacts in the lives of vulnerable New Yorkers.

**Essential Position Functions**:

* In partnership with the State Office of Mental Health oversee the creation of a multi-disciplinary CTI community support team.
* On formation of the team, management of the day-to-day operations in accordance with internal and external regulatory standards and guidelines.
* Coordinate program outreach during an inpatient hospital admission or emergency department visit to both engage in relationship building with individuals served and partner in discharge and aftercare planning with hospital staff.
* Develop meaningful and lasting partnerships with key community stakeholders including local hospitals, criminal justice system, shelter operators and housing providers.
* Facilitate case reviews on ‘members at risk’ with community partners and document recommendations.
* Oversee and or conduct internal audits/case record reviews on a regular basis to measure compliance to regulatory/contract standards, and report aggregated findings and recommendations to the CTI Hub QPM Department on gaps in care or areas for continued improvement.
* Assist with the identification, development, implementation, and completion of quality improvement projects that address barriers to care.
* Ensures that internal and external regulatory agency standards and requirements are met.
* Manage recruitment of staff, as well as address staff performance-related issues in accordance with salient policies and procedures specific to The Bridge.
* Provide regular individual and group supervision to a multi-disciplinary team and orient new team members to policy and procedures as well as provide ongoing training and mentorship.
* Coordinate weekly staff schedules to ensure adequate staff coverage.
* Manage CTI Team's on-call requirements ensuring that 24/7 crisis response is available.
* Work with CTI HUB’s Single Point of Access department to identify eligible participants and reporting on enrollment outcomes and staff assignment.
* Work with all stakeholders (members, network, families, and government staff) in a caring and respectful manner, and with due understanding of and consideration for cultural differences.
* Provide services in a strength-based, recovery oriented, trauma informed and culturally sensitive manner.

**Qualifications, Skills, and Knowledge:**

* Licensed Clinical Social Worker or Licensed Mental Health Counselor.
* A minimum of 3 to 5 years post-masters work experience in the behavioral health and criminal justice field with progressively increasing responsibilities, preferably with the target population. Previous management and supervisory experience preferred.
* Knowledge of treatment, rehabilitation, and community support programs as they relate to recipient/residents, families, and staff.
* Ability to develop, evaluate, implement, and modify treatment intervention to meet the needs of individual recipients.
* Experience managing and supervising program staff in a community mental health setting.
* Well-developed clinical competence in evidence-based and recovery-oriented practices for high-risk, high-needs individuals in behavioral health settings.
* Ability to prepare accurate and timely reports.
* Proficient in electronic health records, preferably Foothold Technology AWARDS.
* Fluency in Spanish preferred.
* Candidates with lived experience are encouraged to apply.

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

Pay: $90,000.00 per year

title: Dental Assistant
description:
**Job Posting: Dental Assistant with X-ray** 

**Position Summary**   
We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Dental Assistant to join our team. As a Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in providing high-quality care to our patients. Your primary responsibilities will include working under the supervision of dentists, performing chairside duties, and ensuring the comfort and well-being of our patients throughout their treatment.

**Qualifications** 

* NJ Dental Assistant License required
* X-ray License required
* High School diploma or GED required
* 1+ years' work experience as a Dental Assistant preferred

**Duties and Responsibilities** 

* Clearly demonstrate knowledge of dental instruments and assist the dentist in rendering patient care chairside.
* Be able to perform basic lab procedures like taking impressions, pouring models, and prepare cases for external labs.
* Maintaining inventory control in the operatories where treatment is rendered by the Provider
* Adhering to OSHA, HIPAA, and CDC guidelines
* Deliver world class patient interactions related to scheduling, follow up treatment, post­ surgical information and record keeping
* Maintaining public area appearance
* Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
* Requires some flexibility in scheduling, such as the ability to work evenings and weekends as needed

**Knowledge and Skills** 

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Knowledge of dental instruments and patient care.
* Ability to clearly communicate medical information to professional practitioners and/or the public.
* Excellent organization, prioritization, follow up, analytical and time management skills with ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.

**Benefits** 

* Generous Paid Time Off (PTO).
* Paid Holidays.
* 401k Retirement plan.
* Competitive pay reflects your skills and dedication.
* Comprehensive Health & Dental insurance coverage.
* Exclusive dental discounts for you and your family.
* Above-Industry-Standard Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
* Opportunities for Growth within our organization.
* Continuing Education opportunities.
* Dedicated Training Support.
* Fun and Collaborative Environment.

**Department: Operations**   
**Reports to: Dental Practice Manager**   
**FLSA Status: Non - Exempt** 

**Company Overview** 

ProSmile stands as the fastest-growing dental organization on the East Coast, boasting the largest network of affiliated multi-specialty dental practices in New Jersey, with a growing presence in Pennsylvania and Maryland. Led by world-class dentists, our premier DSO prioritizes the growth of practices while delivering unparalleled clinical care to patients

**Physical/Mental Demands and Work Environment** 

The physical demands include standing, walking, and operating general office equipment. Reasonable accommodation will be made for individuals with disabilities. The work environment is characterized by low to moderate noise levels.

**Equal Employment**

ProSmile is committed to diversity, inclusion, and equity. We encourage applications from individuals underrepresented in the medical sector. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

**Company Safety**

ProSmile prioritizes the safety and well-being of both our team and patients. We enforce strict adherence to CDC standards, including the use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as face masks, gloves, and gowns.

The Company reserves the right to modify the job description based upon its needs and may require the employee to perform functions beyond those mentioned above. Neither this job description nor any other communication creates an employment contract between the Company and the employee.

description:
One of New York City's Premier Home Health organizations is seeking to hire a Nurse Practitioner on per diem basis. With flexible scheduling and competitive salary + paid training!

Position: **Nurse Practitioner**

Setting: **Home Health**

Job Type: **Per Diem or Part-Time**

Location: **The Bronx**

Pay: **$175.00 - $200.00 per visit**

Visits per day: **On average the NPs do a minimum of 4 visits a day**

Avg. Time Per Visit: **Depending on the acuity of the patient, which may vary, but the NPs typically spend 1.5 hrs. per visit.**

· Valid NYS NP License

· Medicare License (required)

· Performing Annual Examinations (required)

· PECOS Experience (preferred)

· Home Healthcare Experience (preferred)

· EMR Experience, VNSNY used E-Clinical Works (ECW) – (preferred)

A Nurse Practitioner’s duties and responsibilities vary depending on their specialization. For example: A Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner has training in behavioral health and case management & an Acute Care Nurse Practitioner will focus on short-term treatment. Regardless of the specialization, Nurse Practitioners have a few general responsibilities, including:

- Providing primary care to patients

- Performing initial examinations, including physical exams and patient observations

- Setting up and monitoring medical equipment

- Ordering and administering diagnostic tests

- Communicating test results to patients and their families

- Recording patient medical histories

- Operating and maintaining medical equipment

title: Medical Assistant - Plastic Surgery
description:
**MA - Plastic Surgery - Join our amazing team!**

We are looking for a well-organized and experienced MA for a clinical office position.

The ideal candidate may be currently working in a larger medical or surgical office (preferred), and looking for an opportunity to focus on individualized patient care with a smaller team. The candidate may also be ready to utilize more of their skill-set. We are extremely focused on delivering the highest level of care and you would share the same ideals and thrive in a service environment.

This position requires an individual who is energetic, dynamic and extremely organized. Must be able to work autonomously and with other staff as a team. Your role is not only as a nurse, but also to strengthen our patient relationships.

Must be detail oriented, possess strong customer service skills, be able to prioritize tasks with attention to detail, possess excellent communication skills, be able to manage various job duties simultaneously, maintain a high level of customer service and deliver quality patient care. Our office utilizes technology and the ideal candidate would possess advanced computer skills.

Responsibilities include extensive phone and in-person communication with patients; explain procedures, answer questions in a clear manner, provide caring guidance, act as liaison between surgeon and patient, promote surgeon and surgical results, review pre- and post-operative instructions, provide pre- and post-operative care, interface with patients and their families, ability to recognize patient needs and customize individual care, assist in managing the consultation/surgical process, recognize and contribute to the entire patient experience, “hand hold” patients through their surgical decision process.

This position will assist in office procedures alongside the physician as necessary, prepare rooms, track inventory, perform treatments like CoolSculpting and EmSculpt and assist the Surgeon and clinical team as required.

Experience/Requirements:

* MA license with minimum 2 years experience
* Medical office experience in the areas of Plastic Surgery, Dermatology, or surgical facility is preferred but not required
* Demonstrated strong communication and interpersonal skills over the telephone, in written communication and in-person.

To be considered candidates must include a COVER LETTER highlighting your applicable qualifications, your RESUME and **complete the Indeed assessments that are included with this posting. Please do NOT email your resume to the office.**

title: Account Manager (A&D Trade/Luxury Carpet Sales Professional)
description:
STARK is seeking to hire an experienced Luxury Carpet Sales Professional with a proven track-record selling to the trades (Interior Designers, Architectural Firms) for our New York City Showroom.
*Base pay commensurate with experience. Eligible for additional sales commission and/or sales incentive bonus*
**Job Responsibilities:**
Advise clients on product attributes and qualities as related to their needs * - through networking, observing and analyzing market trends and using personal judgment
* Identify potential clients and create strategic client-centric marketing plans (including but not limited to such matters as who to visit, when and how many times to visit).
* Cold call potential clients, using customized sales and marketing scripts that developed on a client-by-client basis. Create pre and post client visit reports, assess purchasing potential of client and deliver analysis to senior management.
* Collaborate on the creation and development of company’s “core message” to clients.
* Develop event strategy, lead and organize events for your specific clients with full discretion over budgets and invitees.
* Prepare sales documents in order to initiate and close sales. Collaborate on the creation of layouts for installation from the design perspective.
* Perform other tasks and duties as assigned.


**Job Requirements:**
* Must have strong relationships with interior design clientele.
* Must possess a strong interest in the interior design trade as well as interpersonal, communication and computer skills.
* Advanced knowledge of carpet qualities, attributes and manufacturing techniques preferred

B.A. / B.S. Degree preferably in Interior Design or related field, and a minimum 2 years sales “to the trade” experience * - or a minimum of 5 years sales “to the trade” experience in lieu of the aforementioned educational preferences.

*Please note: At this time, we are not engaging with third-party or agency recruiters for this position. We appreciate your understanding and request that only individual applicants apply directly. Thank you for respecting our recruitment process.*
**COMPANY INFO**
**About Us:**
With more than 80 years of industry expertise, STARK is the discerning designer’s go-to source for luxurious custom carpet and rugs.
**Our Mission:**  

To live our mission of helping create world class experiences, we believe our first responsibility is making design industry professionals the heroes in their projects because supporting businesses helps to preserve craftsmanship and enable unique and specially designed spaces to exist. In meeting their needs, we must continue to deliver peace of mind service while offering an expansive, diverse, and innovative product assortment that is accessible and convenient.
**Our Heritage:**  

Established by Arthur Stark and his wife Nadia in 1938, the foundation of STARK was always to provide the very best products to our customers. With a rich history, third generation owners Chad Stark, as CEO, and Ashley Stark, as Creative Director, bring the STARK legacy into the new century by staying true to their founding principles. To seek out the best craftsman and methods of manufacturing for the most innovative and beautiful designs.

*Stark Carpet Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.*

title: Health Educator Healthy Relationships
description:
***Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.:*** *Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.*

*Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.*

***Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.***

**Job Summary:**

Under the Program Manager's direct supervision, the Health Educator provides the health relationship curriculum and runs the Peer Leadership Program. Additionally, the Health Educator is responsible for program recruitment, group facilitation, conducting intake/ behavioral assessments to examine risk factors and make appropriate referrals as needed.

**Education**

* **Minimum**: High School Diploma/ GED with at least three (3) years of professional experience in the field or
* Bachelor’s Degree in health education or related field and one (1) year of relevant experience

**Work Experiences:**

* **Minimum**: Two (2) years’ experience working with the population of focus
* Strong outreach Skills, including creating partnerships,
* Experience in group facilitation, comfortable with discussion/teaching classes.
* Familiar with using EHR systems, plus
* Effective communication, including writing, speaking, active listening, and presenting
* **Up to 50% of traveling required.**

**Licensure:** A NYS Driver’s License with at least a two (2) year clean driving record, preferred

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Deliver Healthy Relationship curriculum
* Peer leadership Program to the target population
* Create linkages with agencies that service the HIV+ population such as HASA, medical offices, SROs and shelters, and other agencies to recruit the target population Maintain open communication with the referring sources as required on the progress the participant is making in the program
* Participate in 12 events at BAC
* Attend and participate in 9 events outside of BAC (Including some weekends)
* Conduct all services and satisfy all deliverables as stipulated in the program contract.
* Conduct Behavioral Assessment of clients’ health risk and HIV status to determine client’s risk of acquisition of HIV and STD/HCV
* Make referrals if necessary to other BAC providers to address psychosocial needs
* Attend training and conferences pertaining to the program and target audience.
* Document all services in 24 hours in accordance with BAC recordkeeping policies.
* Other duties as assigned based on program needs.

**Knowledge, Skills, AND Abilities:**

title: Associate Director of Events and Parents' Association Liaison
description:
Job Title: Associate Director of Events and Parents’ Association Liaison  

Department: Advancement  

FLSA Status: Exempt
The Hewitt School - New York, NY
ABOUT HEWITT
Established in 1920 and located in New York City, The Hewitt School is an independent K-12girls’ school whose mission is to inspire girls and young women to become game changers and ethial leaders who forge an equitable, sustainable, and joyous future. Hewitt empowers and expects our community members to embrace multiple points of view, to engage others with empathy and integrity, and to champion equity and justice in all areas of our lives. As a community, Hewitt is fully committed to a culturally diverse faculty, staff, and student body.
  

POSITION SUMMARY  

  

The Hewitt School is seeking candidates for an associate director of events and parents’ association liaison as a member of the advancement team. The associate director of events and parents’ association liaison is responsible for optimizing the experience and touchpoints of key stakeholders - defined as prospective families, current parents and extended families, donors, the professional community, and alumnae.
  

The associate director of events and parents’ association liaison will execute the curation and implementation of all external facing events, defined as an event which includes parents or constituencies outside of the Hewitt student body, but in some cases current students, utilizing careful strategy to advance the mission of The Hewitt School.  

  

The associate director of events and parents’ association liaison will liaise with the Parents’ Association (PA) as their primary contact within the school, supporting all PA events, volunteer efforts, committee meetings, and activities.  

  

Members of the advancement team must have the ability and availability to frequently staff events and meetings in the early morning, evening, and occasionally on weekends. Advanced notice is typically provided.  

  

Reporting to the director of annual giving, the associate director of events and parents’ association liaison is a key member of the advancement team.  

  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES  

  

Event Management
* Collaborate with the advancement team, school leadership, and the Parents’ Association (PA) to curate and facilitate assigned fundraising and community events throughout the year
* Manage event dates, invitations, guest lists, venue selection, vendor oversight, contract negotiation, menu selection, and student and volunteer management for all events assigned (ten major, and approximately thirty minor events per year)
* Attend weekly catering meetings with Hewitt’s on-site dining team
* Comprehensive oversight of the annual benefit, with the goal of reaching, if not exceeding, annual fundraising goals. Responsibilities include volunteer management, auction curation, venue selection, hiring and managing vendors, negotiating contracts, finalizing menu, liaising with the communications office to produce digital, printed, and video content, and day-of oversight
* Management of off-site events at venues and homes throughout New York City, and occasionally outside of New York City
* Consult on, and in some cases attend and oversee, admissions events; diversity, equity and inclusion events; and activities related to the grade 12 experience

Parents’ Association (PA) Liaison
* Serve as primary internal contact for the PA board, leading and inspiring approximately fifteen critical school volunteers
* Represent the parent voice and experience to colleagues within the school
* Attend all PA committee meetings, and sub-committee meetings when necessary
* Facilitate events and activities on behalf of and in partnership with the PA, approximately ten events per year
* Strategize around key volunteer roles and play a part in the management, recruitment, and retention of volunteers throughout the PA
* Oversee the PA budget including accounts billable, contract management and negotiation, and reconciliation
* In collaboration with the PA board, manage payment, inventory, and reconciliation related to the PA merchandise program
* Work with communications on behalf of the PA to compose and send out all PA related communications
* Liaise with academic divisions to ensure correct and timely information is shared with Hewitt parents

Calendar Management
* Primary management of the school calendar including leading the calendar management team (CMT)
* In partnership with the director of technology and campus operations, oversee the calendar related to Hewitt’s major facility rental contracts
* In collaboration with the communications department, ensure all Hewitt event information published in the family and master calendars, and weekly Sunday newsletter, meets editorial style guide standards
* Responsible for managing the external facing online calendar data integration (family calendar) which informs Hewitt families of school events
* Meet with Hewitt’s catering manager on a weekly basis to ensure all event submissions are correct. When necessary, follow-up with faculty and staff on questions related to submissions

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
* Demonstrated commitment to anti-bias education and social justice
* Bachelor’s degree with three to five years of relevant experience
* Ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously: excellent organizational, technological, and follow-up skills
* High intrinsic motivation and capacity for work, strong interpersonal skills, discretion, flexibility, proactivity, ability to set priorities, sterling independent judgment, and a sense of humor
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment that values collaboration and partnership
* Understanding of diversity, equity and inclusivity (DEI) best practices as applied to fundraising activities and proactively engaging with DEI training
* Expertise (i.e. full competency and extensive experience) with Google Suite (Gmail, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides)

QUALIFICATIONS DESIRED
* Experience with Raisers’ Edge, Veracross, Salesforce, or similar fundraising software programs
* Experience with GiveSmart, BidPal, or similar online bidding softwares
* Experience working with volunteers in any capacity
* Proficient with Mac platforms; comfortable with technology or demonstrated ability to learn quickly
* Proven dedication to professional growth and purpose-driven practice

SALARY RANGE
  

Starting Salary Range: $65,000 to $80,000 (salary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience and expertise)  

  

TO APPLY: Please submit a resumé, cover letter, and examples of previous relevant work via our applicant tracking portal. Cover letters should reflect a careful reading of The Hewitt School’s website, including the School’s academic philosophy. No phone calls, please. Recruitment will remain open until the position is filled; applicants should apply as soon as possible for consideration.  

  

IMPORTANT INFORMATION  

  

The Hewitt School is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the School not to discriminate on the basis of any category prohibited by applicable federal, New York State and/or New York City laws/regulations. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment process, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation/benefits, performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, training, working conditions, layoff, and termination.

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Hydro Service & Supplies is a leader in the design, fabrication, installation, and service of high purity water systems. What began as a small start-up Service DI (SDI) company in 1967 is today an industry standard for customized pretreatment and filtration skids, high purity water generation systems, storage and distribution skids, reclamation systems, and high-performance process skids for Life Sciences.

Our New Jersey team is searching for a motivated individual that is technical skilled to manage equipment and perform service related repairs for our clients as a Field Service Technician. This position is a full-time role, regular hours of Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm. Overtime as well as overnight stay may be required during times of peak demand.

**Responsibilities:**

· Traveling to customers' locations, remotely accessing equipment, and performing routine maintenance.

· Provide high level customer service, ensuring that any escalations or concerns are addressed professionally

· Interact with customers in a professional and courteous manner to ensure that their work orders are completed as requested

· Completes all required administrative responsibilities in an accurate and timely manner.

· Responsible for service calls within territory and account assignment.

· Troubleshoots and diagnoses malfunctions to eliminate problem in minimum time.

· Recommends solutions based on the Technical service manual and Field engineering to include our complete line of products.

· Maintains parts inventory and keeps levels of inventory control and usages at peak performance.

· Cooperates with fellow workers and management to achieve Division service goals.

· Perform preventive maintenance on water treatment equipment such as water softeners, carbon filters, RO units, pumps, UV units, storage tanks, and more.

· Be very flexible, and maintain an "on call" status when scheduled (Available for 24/7 emergency response) after completion of training.

· Ensure vehicle, test equipment and tools are maintained in excellent condition

· Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work area.

· Report to: Division Manager

**Experience and Qualification Requirements**

· High School diploma or equivalent required.

· Ability to pass background check and DOT Physical.

· Valid driver’s license w/ record in good standing is required

· Hands on type of background (mechanical, plumbing, and electrical experience helpful).

· Ability to troubleshoot and problem-solve.

· Good customer service skills

· Stay calm under pressure.

· Lift 100 lbs.

· Organized, detail oriented, flexible, high energy, self-starter, innovative, & good communicator

**Position Offers:**

· Competitive hourly salary with overtime.

· Training –Online and Hands-on

· Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits.

· Matching 401k plan

· Short Term / Long Term Disability benefits

· PTO and Paid Holidays

Hydro is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability status, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, protected veteran or military status, and other categories protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What makes you confident that you would excel in this role?

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Clifton, NJ 07013

title: Sales Associate
description:
At Kay, we know that love is unstoppable. Which is why we’re devoted to helping customers Celebrate Life and Express Love in ways every bit as dynamic as they are memorable. From classic must-haves to the latest trends, our selection of quality, responsibly-sourced jewelry has become part of so many love stories over the last century. Kay Jewelers is part of Signet Jewelers, a purpose-driven company who believes love inspires love. Signet is also “Great Place to Work-Certified”™. There are dynamic career paths awaiting you – rewarding opportunities to impact the lives of others and inspire love. Join us!

Kay Jewelers is now hiring **SEASONAL and PART TIME** team members!

Also apply for our **NEW Concierge position** for the holiday season. Seasonal sales support to assist with consistent delivery of excellent customer service, operational standards, and compliance in all areas of operational activity. Supports the creation of a Customer First culture in by taking ownership and control of the day to day customer traffic, line queue, and administrative duties of the store and to achieve and maintain the highest level of efficiency, safety, and security.

Do you thrive on building personal relationships that will last a lifetime? Join our team today to help our customers celebrate life and express love!

**Your role at Kay Jewelers:**

As a part of our Sales Team you are responsible for providing a superior experience to our valued customers. In addition, you will:

* Engage customers in conversation to understand their needs and desires
* Ability to present merchandise and share detailed information regarding features and benefits of products
* Provide information regarding extended service plans and financing options
* Meet individual and team sales goals

**We think you’d be great for this role if you have:**

* A desire to help our customers celebrate the special moments in their lives
* Strong customer service, sales, retail and/or jewelry experience
* Flexible availability to work during “peak” retail hours such as nights, weekends, and holidays
* A positive, customer-focused approach in delivering an exceptional customer experience
* Strong communication and relational skills

**We put our People First by offering the following benefits:**

* Base pay plus commission on sales
* Medical, dental, vision and prescription insurance (full-time team members)
* 401(k)
* Paid Time Off (full-time and part-time team members)
* Paid holidays (full-time team members)
* Tuition reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position
* Training — Associate Training System, Management Training System, District Manager in Training, career development and more
* Merchandise discounts
* Incentive trips and contests

Kay Jewelers is part of the Signet Jewelers family and is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion and diversity for all employees. We value **integrity, teamwork** and offer **opportunities for advancement** as part of our promote from within philosophy.

Please know that while we appreciate every applicant's interest in joining our team, we can only contact those selected for further consideration.

title: Assistant Program Director
description:
The Bridge Inc is hiring an Assistant Director to spearhead care for NYC's street homeless and subway dwellers. Lead our multi-disciplinary team in implementing the Critical Time Intervention model, guiding individuals from street to home. Your role: oversee staff, manage operations, conduct outreach, enhance living skills, provide counseling, and advocate for health equity. Enjoy fieldwork, flexible hours, and a chance to reshape community healthcare while impacting lives positively.

**Assistant Program Director Essential Position Functions:**

* Lead the SOS team alongside the Program Director, providing clinical and operational guidance.
* Conduct proactive outreach at transit "hot spots" and during hospital admissions, employing strength-based approaches.
* Collaborate with street outreach teams, local authorities, hospitals, MTA, and caregivers to identify and support individuals in need.
* Perform thorough assessments using conversational, observational, and formalized risk assessment tools to address health and social needs.
* Coordinate housing placements through the SOR Hub, assisting with applications, interviews, and transition logistics.
* Facilitate hospital discharge planning to link participants with essential community resources.
* Offer short-term therapeutic counseling pre and post-housing placement to support transition and stability.
* Collect and analyze data, collaborating with analysts to refine care strategies and improve outcomes.
* Conduct in-depth psychosocial assessments, reviewing documentation and collateral information to inform care plans.
* Monitor participant progress towards achieving care plan goals and meticulously record outcomes.
* Actively participate in team meetings, supervisory sessions, and fulfill assigned duties as necessary to support team cohesion and effectiveness.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* **Must-have**: Licensed Master’s degree in social work, mental health counseling, nursing, or psychology.
* Experience working with homeless and/or precariously housed populations preferred; management skills development interest.
* Knowledge of NYC homeless resources, shelter systems, and MTA transit is advantageous.
* Familiarity with counseling principles for mental illness and substance use disorders.
* Understanding of treatment, rehabilitation, and community support programs for recipients, families, and staff.
* Proficiency in crisis management, de-escalation techniques, and violence prevention strategies.
* Ability to develop, implement, and adjust treatment interventions for individual needs.
* Strong computer skills including Health Information Technology and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Spanish proficiency a plus.

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

description:

Business is Booming at our Dealership! We are seeking **Dynamic Service Managers** to join our world class service team. We have an immediate opening for **Motivated, Seasoned Service Department Managers.**  This is an outstanding opportunity for a rewarding career with a mission driven company.

* Do you have a proven record of success with verifiable CSI scores?
* Do you have a desire to win?

Opportunities for career advancement.
